headline: International Paper Resets With Regional Split Plant Closure And Cost Focus
summary: International Paper (NYSE:IP) plans to separate into two independent companies focused on North America and EMEA. The company is permanently closing its Georgetown, SC container plant as part of a broader restructuring. Management has outlined significant cost-cutting measures alongside targeted investment plans for each new business. International Paper, trading at $43.55, is reshaping its business around distinct regional priorities, with one company centered on North America and the...
